alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 1:00AM CST until January 09 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following counties, Clarke and Washington. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Wagarville, Leroy, Saint Stephens, Tibbie, McIntosh, Wagar, Cortelyou, Prestwick, Sunflower, Carson, Toinette, Hawthorn, Rockville, Mays Crossroads, Walker Springs, Salitpa, McVay, Rutan and Toddtown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
